===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|り}}
Probably from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=り}} {{m|zh|浬}}. The {{m|zh|浬}} character does not appear in ancient texts.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|り}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|り}}

# a [[nautical mile]]: the [[length]] of roughly one [[minute]] of [[latitude]], 1,852 [[meter]]s

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|かいり}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かいり}} compound {{m|zh|海里|tr=xoj<sup>X</sup> li<sup>X</sup>|lit=sea, ocean + unit of distance}}. The single-kanji spelling {{lang|ja|浬}} is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]].

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|かいり|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かいり}}

# a [[nautical mile]]: the [[length]] of roughly one [[minute]] of [[latitude]], 1,852 [[meter]]s

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|のっと}}
From {{etyl|en|ja|sort=のっと}} {{m|en|knot|pos=unit of speed}}. The kanji spelling {{lang|ja|浬}} is an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]].

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|ノット|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|節}}, {{l|ja|ノット}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ノット}}

# a [[knot]]: a [[nautical]] [[unit]] of [[speed]], one [[nautical mile]] [[per]] [[hour]]

=====Usage notes=====
The katakana spelling {{l|ja|ノット}} is more common in modern Japanese than either kanji spelling of {{lang|ja|浬}} or {{l|ja|節}}.
